modules.description: Handles parsing and serialization of DHCP protocol messages from wire traffic, supporting options and message types specific to DHCP. Operates on byte sequences and custom record types representing DHCP packets and options. Used to decode incoming DHCP requests and generate appropriate server responses in networked applications.

The module provides bidirectional conversions between numeric values and structured DHCP protocol elements, such as message types, option codes, hardware types, and client identifiers, while processing DHCP packets and option lists to extract network configuration data like IP addresses, routes, and server information. It enables low-level parsing and serialization of DHCP messages, with functions tailored for retrieving specific option values, handling client IDs, and managing vendor-specific parameters through patterned data extraction. Use cases include network configuration retrieval, client identifier parsing, and protocol-level data transformation in DHCP interactions.
